Credit Conditions Signal

Credit conditions composite: HY/BBB spreads and equity volatility.

As of Unknown

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Credit Conditions signal (1) is currently in a `Neutral` regime as of 2026-01-31, with a composite value of -0.412786. This indicates stable and benign funding conditions.
  • Conviction: Medium, Interpretation Confidence: High Confidence, Internal Conflict Flag: No.

Key Dynamics:

  • The `Neutral` state is driven by low corporate bond spreads: HY OAS at 2.83 and BBB OAS at 1.01 (1).
  • Equity implied volatility (VIX) is also subdued at 14.51 (1). All three component z-scores are negative, consistently indicating low financial stress.
  • Conditional Invalidation: A rise in the smoothed Credit Conditions composite above 0.75 would signal a shift to `Tightening` conditions (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Credit conditions remain `Neutral`, maintaining a stable funding backdrop with spreads and volatility near typical ranges (1).
  • Upside secondary: Conditions could ease further if economic data strengthens or monetary policy becomes more dovish, narrowing spreads and lowering volatility.
  • Downside residual: An unexpected negative economic shock or significant policy shift could widen corporate spreads and increase VIX, leading to `Tightening` (1).

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Cyclical (months), reflecting the 3-month exponential moving average and rolling normalisation windows used in its construction (1).
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: High, as credit conditions are a fundamental determinant of risk appetite, investment flows, and overall economic performance.

Macro Relevance:

  • This signal informs the Liquidity and Sentiment macro dimensions. It currently suggests a mid-cycle position with stable financial conditions.
  • It typically interacts with macro signals related to economic growth, inflation expectations, and monetary policy, influencing capital allocation and risk exposure (1).

Data & References:

  • ICE BofA US High Yield Option-Adjusted Spread (HY_OAS), latest 2.83 as of 2026-01-31 (1).
  • ICE BofA US BBB Option-Adjusted Spread (BBB_OAS), latest 1.01 as of 2026-01-31 (1).
  • CBOE Volatility Index (VIXCLS), latest 14.51 as of 2026-01-31 (1).
  • Additional public datasets that would improve depth or reliability: Senior Loan Officer Opinion Survey (SLOOS) on bank lending standards.
